intro: Daucus azoricus, commonly known as the Azorean carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a mild, carroty scent. Daucus azoricus is adapted to the island's maritime climate and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
